intro: Pedicularis stewardii, commonly known as the Stewart's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Pacific Northwest. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often resembling orchids. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as meadows and forest edges. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
